column2: Sentence
column5: Comp Q

column2: The popular cheerleader heard the story had gone all over school.
column5: Was the story contained?

column2: The school staff printed the article was stolen from the office.
column5: Was the article taken from the office?

column2: The absent-minded grandmother forgot the key was still in her pocket.
column5: Was the key in a drawer?

column2: The ignorant citizen advocated the strategy would promote nuclear power.
column5: Did the citizen believe the strategy supported nuclear power?

column2: The adventurous sailor discovered the wreck contained several rare medicinal plants.
column5: Were rare plants housed in the wreck?

column2: The aging hippie protested the policy was started for selfish reasons.
column5: Was the policy started for compassionate reasons?

column2: The enthusiastic manager accepted the money was intended for her client.
column5: Was the money for the manager?

column2: The tour guide warned the spectators were scared by ghost sightings.
column5: Were the observers frightened?

column2: The struggling pupil understood that the message was important for his grade.
column5: Was the message important for the student’s success?

column2: The job applicant emphasized that the problems couldn't be resolved by Friday.
column5: Could the issue be resolved by the end of the work week?

column2: The bestselling author wrote that the essay was based on autobiographical events.
column5: Was the essay based on the author’s life?

column2: The curious toddler learned that the equations gave her brother a headache.
column5: Did the equations frustrate her brother?

column2: The abashed publicist confirmed that the rumor was started by his daughter.
column5: Did the publicist’s daughter generate the rumor?

column2: The vehement columnist asserted that the belief was drastically misleading the masses.
column5: Did the columnist think the opinion was correct?

column2: The apprentice mechanic maintained that the machinery was broken beyond repair.
column5: Could the machine be fixed?

column2: The befuddled foreigner repeated that the poem did not make logical sense.
column5: Did the foreigner understand the poem?

column2: The nervous candidate believed the interviewer had asked him interesting questions.
column5: Did the candidate like the interviewer’s questions?

column2: The brilliant researcher figured the sum was impossible given the equation.
column5: Did the equation make the process easier?

column2: The rookie athlete realized the mistake ruined her chances of winning.
column5: Would the athlete lose because of the mistake?

column2: The undergraduate student concluded the lesson would not actually be useful.
column5: Was there a valuable lesson taught?

column2: The defense attorney inferred the reason would be argued strongly.
column5: Would the reason be argued well?

column2: The freshman senator indicated the problem could be fixed through perseverance.
column5: Was the problem permanent?

column2: The auto mechanic admitted the error was on purpose for money.
column5: Was the error deceiving?

column2: The appreciative employee implied the raise would help pay his debts.
column5: Did the raise disappoint the employee?

column2: The respected actress suggested that the scene had been written very poorly.
column5: Was the actress satisfied?

column2: The train conductor worried that the passengers wouldn’t enjoy the long trip.
column5: Was the trip going to be long?

column2: The angry protestor proved that the theory would not be universally accepted.
column5: Was the theory popular?

column2: The naïve politician assumed that the burden had was not his to carry.
column5: Was the politician responsible for the problem?

column2: The young teacher argued that the issue must be discussed in class.
column5: Was there a topic discussed?

column2: The music reviewer decided that the appeal would not attract the band.
column5: Was the band turned off by the appeal?

column2: The strict manager suspected that the workers deserved more discipline than required.
column5: Were the workers unreliable?

column2: The ruthless outlaw claimed that the reward would not be convincing enough.
column5: Would the outlaw be turned in because of the reward?

column2: The hostess who surprised the father opened a bottle of fresh champagne.
column5: Did the hostess open a beer?

column2: The bishop who amazed the deacon drank the wine in the sanctuary.
column5: Did the bishop drink water?

column2: The celebrity who shocked the cameraman spent the day at the zoo.
column5: Did the celebrity go to the aquarium?

column2: The grandmother who fed the child took a nap in the afternoon.
column5: Did the grandmother watch tv?

column2: The officer who arrested the inspector released a statement to the press.
column5: Did the officer avoid the press?

column2: The therapist who trained the masseuse heated bath water for a client.
column5: Did the therapist give cold baths?

column2: The doctor who examined the resident stitched a wound with great ease.
column5: Did the wound give the doctor difficulty?

column2: The architect who fired the engineer built town houses for rich heiresses.
column5: Did the architect build country homes?

column2: The neighbor who imitated the housewife earned prize money for her pies.
column5: Did the neighbor bake pies?

column2: The student who frightened the classmate received a detention when classes ended.
column5: Did the student have to stay after school?

column2: The horticulturist who irritated the landscaper used his intuition to grow flowers.
column5: Did the horticulturist use his instincts?

column2: The man who kicked the criminal participated in therapy for anger management.
column5: Did the man have trouble with anger?

column2: The prostitute who outsmarted the pimp counted her money in the alley.
column5: Did the prostitute go through her cash?

column2: The governor who blackmailed the mobster turned up dead in his office.
column5: Did the governor die?

column2: The chef who extolled the talk show host brought good business the whole year.
column5: Did the chef attract business?

column2: The servant who seduced the maid went to college on a scholarship.
column5: Did the servant attend college?

column2: The mole who the defector exposed rejected the offer on the spot.
column5: Did the mole accept the offer?

column2: The singer who the organizer blamed cancelled the concert in Los Angeles.
column5: Did the singer perform in LA?

column2: The acrobat who the clown mocked performed the trick at the show.
column5: Did the acrobat skip the show?

column2: The customer who the seller upset forgot the receipt on the counter.
column5: Did the customer remember the receipt?

column2: The partner who the businessman introduced presented the report at the meeting.
column5: Did the partner miss the meeting?

column2: The messenger who the knight summoned read the letter from the king.
column5: Did the messenger read a book?

column2: The linguist who the historian ridiculed proposed the hypothesis for the problem.
column5: Did the linguist disagree with the hypothesis?

column2: The biker who the driver ignored made the turn at the crossing.
column5: Did the biker go straight?

column2: The lover who the painter regretted sent a rose in the evening.
column5: Did the lover give a flower?

column2: The musician who the producer sensed played the piano in the studio.
column5: Did the musician play in the studio?

column2: The principal who the scholar judged patrolled the hall during school hours.
column5: Did the principal walk the hallways?

column2: The teammate who the athlete revived won the game on the field.
column5: Did the teammate win the game?

column2: The wizard who the medicine man healed stopped the boat at the bridge.
column5: Did the wizard halt the boat?

column2: The lord who the lady embraced ate the muffin in the kitchen.
column5: Did the lord eat in the kitchen?

column2: The guard who the agent watched took a break at the shop.
column5: Did the guard take a break?

column2: The sister who the brother supervised got some crayons from the box.
column5: Did the sister get crayons?

column2: The clerk at the records office clarified the confusing statement on the application.
column5: Was the statement very straightforward?

column2: The handsome prince offered but his bride's family declined the fortune.
column5: Would the prince remain a bachelor?

column2: The two friends wagered their allowance on who would get the highest test score.
column5: Did the friends bet on a baseball game?

column2: The mysterious woman divulged her deepest and darkest secrets to the bus driver.
column5: Was the woman very shy?

column2: The radio newscaster verified the short and exciting report before the broadcast.
column5: Was the report true?

column2: The bargain shopper saw the beautiful and expensive raincoat after the sale was over.
column5: Was the shopper careless with cash?

column2: The exuberant team planned a huge and extravagant party for after the game.
column5: Did the team feel good about things?

column2: The science teacher verified the unexpected results because she found them implausible.
column5: Did the results seem strange?

column2: The temporary assistant saw the short and inappropriate memo while rummaging through the files.
column5: Did the assistant notice the memo?

column2: The injured man imagined the attack while in the emergency room.
column5: Had the man been assaulted?

column2: The worried mother determined the explanation for why her son had been avoiding her.
column5: Was the mother concerned about her son?

column2: The flight attendant clarified the instructions when the passengers asked questions.
column5: Was the flight attendant helpful?

column2: The church workers offered the kids a free bible and some coloring books.
column5: Did the workers offer them food?

column2: The curious girl comprehended the answer but asked the question again.
column5: Did the girl understand the first time?

column2: The office staff raced but there was no clear winner.
column5: Did someone come in first place?

column2: The teacher's assistant divulged the purpose of her colleague's absence.
column5: Did the assistant know the purpose?

column2: Many of the cheerleaders recalled the difficult and strenuous routine from last year's homecoming game.
column5: Did the cheerleaders forget the routine?

column2: The attorneys for the family disputed the authorities' version of what transpired.
column5: Were the events completely agreed upon?

column2: The wealthy investor regretted the bad and unfortunate decision once he realized the consequences.
column5: Was the investor rich?

column2: The models in the fashion show revealed their stylish tank tops.
column5: Were the models wearing sweaters?

column2: The I.R.S. agent demanded the full amount the week following the audit.
column5: Did the audit go well?

column2: The poodle recognized his owner's scent on the clothing that was discovered.
column5: Did the dog have a keen sense of smell?

column2: The waitress promised her regulars a free cup of coffee.
column5: Would the regulars have eggs?

column2: The foreign students sat down but couldn't understand the lecture.
column5: Were the students a bit confused?

column2: The angry mob announced their demands but still refused to negotiate.
column5: Did the mob want to compromise?

column2: The nervous teenager lied to the judge to avoid incriminating his friend.
column5: Did the witness commit perjury?

column2: The bored librarian painted her fingernails after shelving several books.
column5: Was the librarian very busy?

column2: The interior decorator hammered away and hung the painting on the wall.
column5: Did the decorator hang a poster?

column2: The new salesman insulted the stranger and she left the store.
column5: Was the stranger satisfied?

column2: The soccer player kicked the ball through the goalie's hands.
column5: Did the soccer player score?

column2: The thoughtful daughter cared for her elderly mother.
column5: Was the mother taken care of?

column2: The new homeowner slept in the room next to the garden.
column5: Did the homeowner sleep near plants and shrubs?
